body.p: Couchbase Server 4.5 leaps forward with faster, simpler, and more secure data processing. Take a look at What's new? for a list of new features and improvements that are available in this Beta release. The Beta version of Couchbase Server 4.5 is intended for development purposes only. We consider Beta releases to have some rough edges and bugs, and may change before the final GA release. The Beta release is not supported in production.

This Beta release version of Couchbase Server 4.5 includes new features and behavior changes. The following sections list out the upgrade considerations, behavior changes, limitations, known issues, and deprecated items.

section.title: Upgrade
section.p: Couchbase Server 4.5 Beta requires a fresh install of Couchbase. Upgrading from an earlier version of Couchbase Server is not supported in the Beta release.

section.title: Behavior Changes
section.p: Here are the behavior changes in the product, compared to the previous release:

ul.li: Disabling scientific notation for integers. With this change, large integers are no longer displayed in the scientific notation in N1QL. Details for the change can be found in MB-14720.

PENDING index state is now represented as DEFERRED and BUILDING. With this change, global indexes no longer display a PENDING state under the status in SYSTEM:INDEXES. Instead, global indexes that are actively being built display BUILDING and global indexes that are created with the DEFER_BUILD option display DEFERRED for the status attribute in the SYSTEM:INDEXES output in N1QL. Details for the change can be found in MB-14679.

The new backup tool is not backward compatible with older backup files from previous releases. If you want to take a backup of a previous release and then load and restore it in Couchbase 4.5, you should use the cbbackup tool (not the new backup tool). After you restore the data into release 4.5, you can start using the new backup tool for subsequent backup/restore operations to other Couchbase Server 4.5 nodes.

In the top left corner of the Couchbase Web Console, there is a link to the Classic UI, which is provided as a workaround for testing in case you encounter any issues with new angular-based UI. The Classic UI link will be removed in the 4.5 GA release.

section.title: Limitations
section.p: Here are the limitations you will encounter when using Couchbase Server 4.5 Developer Preview:

ul.li: FTS is only supported on a single node in a cluster. You can have multiple nodes in the cluster, but only one node can run the FTS service. You are not prevented from starting the FTS service on multiple nodes. However, if you do, you may encounter undefined behavior.
FTS wonâ€™t have the following options: rebalance, failover or rollback.

Experimental FTS API support is available in Java 2.2.4 with Couchbase 4.5 DP availability. Experimental FTS API support begins with the following SDK versions currently scheduled for early April 2016: Python 2.0.9, GO 1.06, NET 2.2.7, and Node.js 2.1.5.
There is currently no authorization enforcement for FTS operations
Query monitoring and profiling information is accessed through cbq command-line, Query Workbench, and REST APIs.

The Couchbase Web Console does not display the Query tab if the query service on that node is not installed and running. The tab will show links to other nodes in the cluster that are running the query service.

The Array Indexing feature has these limitations in 4.5 Developer Preview:
Supports only ARRAY, DISTINCT, IN, and WITHIN operators.
Does not support covering indexes.
Does not maintain duplicate elements of an array or the position of elements within an array, and hence does not support expressions reconstructing the full array, or address the elements by position.
Memory-optimized indexes are not supported on Windows 64-bit platforms.

Memory-optimized indexes is a cluster-wide setting and currently cannot coexist with other types of GSI indexes such as ForestDB. Memory-optimized indexes must completely fit in memory. Mutations will not get propagated to the indexes in case of out-of-memory errors.

During installation, you can choose between ForestDB or Memory Optimized Indexes to manage Global Secondary Indexes. Changing the optimization mode of global indexes is not supported when index service nodes are present in the cluster. Remove all index service nodes to change this option.
Array Indexes are limited to array size of 10KB: MB-18121
UNNEST queries cannot use array indexes: MB-17873
Only the role of the full administrator is implemented in this preview. Administrators will have to log into Couchbase using full administrator credentials to manage the cluster.
Experimental Sub-Document API Support is available beginning with GO 1.04, Java SDK 2.2.4, and in libcouchbase (C) 2.5.6 Couchbase 4.5 DP availability.
Enterprise Backup and Restore feature is not supported on Windows.

section.title: Known Issues
section.p: This list covers some of the known problems with Couchbase Server 4.5 Developer Preview. Please read this before reporting any new bugs, and watch for updates as new bugs are discovered.

row.entry: Memory-optimized indexes are not supported on Windows 64-bit platforms. On Windows platforms, using GSI with memory-optimized indexes may cause the indexer to throw an exception.
SCRAM-SHA512 and SCRAM-SHA256 do not apply for OSX.
UI: Indexer storage option is frozen to global for the first indexer node after setting indexer storage to memory-optimised.
Removing a document with a correct CAS fails after removal was tried with a wrong CAS.
N1QL: Array Indexing - Indexing meta().id with an array gives an incorrect result for the select meta fields.
Composite Array Indexes on fields within the same array do not work as desired.
Array Indexing: Support duplicates array items indexing.
Enterprise Backup and Restore: backup cluster command is not working on Windows.
When adding a node to a cluster, add-node does not correctly deploy the selected services.
N1QL: Index created on an array(not an array index) not being preferred over primary index.
N1QL: Composite Array Index is not preferred over single array index. It can be overcome via USE INDEX.
N1QL: Unnest queries don't work with array indexes.
FTS: No indexing activity noted for 60 seconds.
FTS: Unable to create more than 10 indexes.
Memcached was not terminated properly during Couchbase Server shutdown.
Flush operation failed for the sample travel bucket.
Spatial views are broken after rebalance.

section.title: Deprecated Items
section.p: Starting with the Version 4.5 (Developer Preview) of Couchbase Server, the Microsoft Windows 32-bit operating system is not supported.
